head.title: Sister of S.I. Woman In Abuse Case Is Held

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Sister of S.I. Woman In Abuse Case Is Held

abstract.p: Chaniqua Allston is arrested after city officials find her 6-year-old son home alone; she called police on July 4 to report that her sister, Deanna Allston of Staten Island, had abused five foster children, nearly starving to death 2-year-old Dennis Davis (M)

block.p: The sister of a Staten Island woman who was charged this weekend with nearly starving to death a child in her care was arrested last night after city officials found her 6-year-old son home alone, the police said.

The sister, Chaniqua Allston, 23, was arrested at 10:20 P.M. and charged with endangering the welfare of a minor, said Officer Valerie St. Rose, a police spokeswoman. Officials of the city's Administration for Children's Services had gone to the home on a case visit, Officer St. Rose said.

The sister of a Staten Island woman who was charged this weekend with nearly starving to death a child in her care was arrested last night after city officials found her 6-year-old son home alone, the police said.

The sister, Chaniqua Allston, 23, was arrested at 10:20 P.M. and charged with endangering the welfare of a minor, said Officer Valerie St. Rose, a police spokeswoman. Officials of the city's Administration for Children's Services had gone to the home on a case visit, Officer St. Rose said.
Ms. Allston called the police Saturday to report that her sister, Deanna Allston, 31, had abused five foster children, particularly Dennis Davis, a 2-year-old who weighed 18 pounds.

In another case yesterday, a Brooklyn woman was charged with child endangerment after police officers responding to a domestic dispute found her three children unkempt and without food in a dirty apartment.

A Police Department spokesman, Cadet Donald Stewart, said the officers saw the squalid conditions in the apartment at 183 Menahan Street in the Bushwick section and found the children -- a girl, 8, and two boys, ages 1 and 6, Cadet Stewart said. The year-old boy, he said, had been wearing a dirty diaper for ''a long period of time.''
The officers arrested the children's mother, Carmen Burnes, 31, who was charged with endangering the welfare of a child. The children were taken by the Administration for Children's Services.
